comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: "Plague" album Vol. V, "277 Corner of Cumberland and Little Essex-street". Digital Order No. a147277 acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/album/albumView.aspx?acmsID=413021&... See Thumbnail p.3

comment.author: 29029178@N03
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Pubs of Australia, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/] As beachcomberaustralia noted, this is one of John Degotardi Jr.'s "Plague Album" photos, so it can be dated to 1900.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: This photo was recently determined to be part of the Rocks Resumption photographic survey, the title and date of the image has been changed accordingly Here is a map of the Rocks Resumption area (last one in the sequence)

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content:
That timber structure must have been demolished not long after the photo was taken, as it is not present in this other Rocks Resumption photo - but the whitewashed wall on the Flagstaff Hotel is clearly visible!
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/3810093259/]
